Part 2C covers **managerial decision-making** techniques.

- **Relevant Costs** - Decision costs

- **Uncertainty** - Risk analysis

| Area | Focus |
|------|-------|
| CVP | Break-even |
| Relevant costs | Decisions |

slides.title: CVP Analysis
slides.content:
# Cost-Volume-Profit

## Break-Even

```
BEP (units) = Fixed Costs / CM per unit

BEP (dollars) = Fixed Costs / CM Ratio
```

## Contribution Margin

```
CM = Price - Variable Cost

CM Ratio = CM / Price
```

## Target Profit

```
Units = (Fixed Costs + Target Profit) / CM

For after-tax target:
Pre-tax profit = Target / (1 - Tax Rate)
```

slides.title: Multi-Product CVP
slides.content:
# Sales Mix Analysis

## Weighted Average CM

```
WACM = Sum of (CM x Sales Mix %)

BEP = Fixed Costs / WACM
```

## Assumptions

- Constant sales mix
- Linear relationships
- Relevant range

## Sensitivity

| Change | Effect |
|--------|--------|
| Higher CM products | Lower BEP |
| Lower CM products | Higher BEP |

slides.title: Relevant Costs
slides.content:
# Decision-Making Costs

## Relevant Costs

| Relevant | Not Relevant |
|----------|-------------|
| Future | Past (sunk) |
| Differential | Committed |
| Avoidable | Unavoidable |

## Opportunity Cost

```
Value of next best alternative foregone

Always relevant for decisions
```

## Sunk Costs

```
Already incurred
Cannot be changed
Ignore for decisions
```

slides.title: Special Decisions
slides.content:
# Short-Term Decisions

## Make or Buy

```
Compare:
- Internal manufacturing cost
- External purchase cost
+ Opportunity cost
```

## Special Orders

```
Accept if:
Price > Incremental cost

Consider:
- Excess capacity
- Market impact
```

## Discontinue Segment

```
Eliminate if:
Segment margin < 0

Keep if:
Contributes to fixed costs
```

slides.title: Pricing Decisions
slides.content:
# Pricing Strategies

## Methods

| Method | Approach |
|--------|----------|
| Cost-plus | Cost + markup |
| Target return | ROI-based |
| Market | Competitor-based |
| Value | Customer-perceived |

## Target Pricing

```
Target Price - Target Profit = Target Cost

Design to cost if gap exists
```

## Price Elasticity

```
Elasticity = % Change Demand / % Change Price

|E| > 1: Elastic
|E| < 1: Inelastic
```

slides.title: Capital Budgeting Basics
slides.content:
# Investment Decisions

## Methods

| Method | Criterion |
|--------|----------|
| Payback | Time to recover |
| NPV | Present value |
| IRR | Rate of return |
| Profitability index | PV/Cost |

## Cash Flow Identification

| Include | Exclude |
|---------|--------|
| Incremental | Sunk costs |
| After-tax | Allocated overhead |
| Opportunity | Financing costs |
| Working capital | Non-cash |

slides.title: NPV and IRR
slides.content:
# Discounted Cash Flow

## Net Present Value

```
NPV = Sum of PV of Cash Flows - Initial Cost

PV = CF / (1 + r)^n

Accept if NPV > 0
```

## Internal Rate of Return

```
Rate where NPV = 0

Accept if IRR > Cost of Capital
```

## NPV vs IRR

| Scenario | Conflict |
|----------|----------|
| Mutually exclusive | Use NPV |
| Different scales | Use NPV |
| Reinvestment assumption | NPV more realistic |

slides.title: Risk in Capital Budgeting
slides.content:
# Risk Analysis

## Sensitivity Analysis

```
Test how changes in one variable
affect project NPV
```

## Scenario Analysis

| Scenario | Approach |
|----------|----------|
| Best case | Optimistic |
| Base case | Most likely |
| Worst case | Pessimistic |

## Monte Carlo Simulation

- Multiple scenarios
- Probability distributions
- Statistical output

## Risk-Adjusted Discount Rate

```
Higher risk = Higher discount rate
= Lower NPV
```

slides.title: Real Options
slides.content:
# Option Value

## Types of Real Options

| Option | Value |
|--------|-------|
| Delay | Wait for information |
| Expand | Scale up |
| Abandon | Cut losses |
| Switch | Change inputs |

## Valuation

```
Project Value = NPV + Option Value

Options add value in uncertainty
```

## When to Consider

- High uncertainty
- Irreversible investment
- Information arrival expected

slides.title: Decision Trees
slides.content:
# Sequential Decisions

## Structure

```
        [Decision]
       /          \\
     A              B
     |              |
  [Chance]       [Chance]
    /  \\           /  \\
  Good  Bad     Good  Bad
```

## Analysis Steps

1. Map decisions and outcomes
2. Assign probabilities
3. Calculate expected values
4. Work backward
5. Choose optimal path

## Expected Value

```
EV = Sum of (Probability x Outcome)
```

slides.title: Linear Programming
slides.content:
# Constrained Optimization

## Elements

| Element | Description |
|---------|-------------|
| Objective function | Maximize/minimize |
| Constraints | Limitations |
| Decision variables | What to decide |

## Example

```
Maximize: Z = 5X + 3Y

Subject to:
2X + Y <= 100
X + Y <= 80
X, Y >= 0
```

## Solution

- Graph constraints
- Find feasible region
- Test corner points
- Optimal at a corner
